attributes.action: Introduce a PM recall system to the UK
attributes.additional_details: Citizens currently have no direct way to remove an unpopular Prime Minister between elections. A recall system would allow a petition for re-election to trigger a no-confidence vote, requiring 1 million signatures on the petition and at least 65% public turnout on the vote, strengthening democratic accountability and giving the public a real voice.
attributes.background: Introduce a PM recall system allowing the public to trigger a re-election if the Prime Minister loses significant public support, ensuring accountability and democratic choice between elections.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions, which call for similar action: 

"Give the British Public the Right to Vote No Confidence in the Government" https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/734311

"Pass a law that triggers an early General Election via a public petition" https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/739383
